Attended the Consultative Committee of Parliament for the Ministry of Education Meeting in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, chaired by Union Education Minister Shri Dharmendra Pradhan. The meeting focused on a vital theme ‚Äî Promotion of Education in Bharatiya Bhasha in Higher Education.

Also present were Union MoS Dr. Sukanta Majumdar, Shri Sanjay Kumar (Secretary, Department of School Education and Literacy), Dr. Vineet Joshi (Secretary, Higher Education), and senior officials from AICTE, UGC, and the Bharatiya Bhasha Samiti.

It was a meaningful platform to learn about how Indian languages are being integrated into higher education through policy, technology, and institutional support.

The exhibition that followed was equally enriching. The Jadui Pitara stood out ‚Äî a play-based learning kit for children aged 3 to 8, featuring puzzles, toys, flashcards, and books that reflect India‚Äôs diverse cultures and languages. A joyful beginning to a child‚Äôs learning journey.

I also explored tech-led tools like Anuvadini and Bhashini, using AI to enable translation and voice recognition across Indian languages, and platforms like SWAYAM, ePathshala, and Bharatiya Bhasha Pustak, making regional language learning resources widely accessible.

These efforts embody the vision of the National Education Policy ‚Äî an education system that is inclusive, multilingual, and culturally rooted.

Grateful to all dignitaries and the Ministry of Education for this opportunity.
